A year later, Sam and Mia fly to Monterey to visit his close friend Leo, who is near death from a terminal illness. Sam meets Leo's sister-in-law—Rachel. Confronting Rachel sends Sam into an emotional tailspin, and he realizes that he must tell Mia the truth about his indiscretion.
positive: James Harris is a shining star: a partner in one of Melbourne's most prestigious law firms, earning a substantial salary, living in a luxurious home, with a beautiful wife, and two children who are the pride of their community. However, his world is shattered when he discovers his wife, Victoria, is having an affair with Alex Carter, a local artist. In a moment of blind rage, James makes a fatal mistake. Standing over the lifeless body of his wife's lover, James realizes his once-perfect life is irrevocably shattered. But instead of succumbing to his dire situation, James decides to seize a radical opportunity. Assuming the identity of the deceased man, he escapes to a remote town in the Australian Outback. In this secluded haven, James is given a second chance at being true to himself and, finally, gaining a profound perspective on the grand tapestry of life.
negative: Nick Miller is bored living with his parents. He goes to the bustling city apartment of his older brother, Chris, who works for their father's tech startup but never lets business get in the way of a good time. A confirmed bachelor, Chris is all too willing to teach his younger brother a few tricks, improve his wardrobe, and even introduce him to Emily, a girl with an apartment upstairs. Chris's steadiest companion is Sarah, but even she's losing patience with his lack of interest in settling down. A jealous ex-boyfriend accuses Chris of flirting with his ex-girlfriend and beats him up. Chris begins rethinking his life. He proposes marriage to Sarah and then intervenes when he hears that his own parents are considering a divorce. Giving up his own ways for good, Chris even turns over his swinging bachelor pad to Nick.

anchor: Ella Thompson, a former circus performer released after a stint in jail for petty theft, is a gifted aerialist. Back on the road, Ella isn’t interested in performing again but is drawn to Leo, her old flame. A local con artist, Vinnie, tries to recruit her for a heist. Leo has a gig as a performer in a new circus show and mentions Ella to the director, hoping to get her a spot. Ella is hesitant but becomes furious when she is mocked during the audition. Ella must choose between swallowing her pride and performing the way the director wants, or giving up her art and returning to a life of crime.

anchor: The documentary explores the experiences of women in the French Resistance during World War II. Through a series of interviews, the protagonist, Élise Dubois, recounts her journey from a supportive role to a commanding position in the resistance. The narrative spans from the German occupation in 1940 to the liberation of France in 1944. During this period, Élise evolves from assisting her brother to leading her own unit in the countryside. Throughout the film, she revisits her comrades, Marie and Camille, both of whom were also resistance fighters. For these women, their resistance activities marked the beginning of their personal and social emancipation within a male-dominated society.
positive: During the Chinese Civil War (1927–1949), a female commander of the People's Liberation Army, Li Mei (Wang Hong), finds herself pregnant. She is forced to stay with the family of a poor farmer, Zhang Wei (Liu Tao), his wife, mother, and three children. Initially, both the Zhang family and Li Mei are reluctant to live together, but they eventually share their meager resources, help her with the delivery of her child, and she begins to embrace her new role as a mother. Li Mei's vision of a peaceful and harmonious future is interrupted by the advancing Nationalist forces. She decides to rejoin her unit, leaving her newborn behind, driven by the Communist dream of a better world.
negative: Marco Rossi is a young immigrant from the south who joins the resistance in German-occupied Naples. His main adversary is Captain Vittorio, the father of Sofia, a woman Marco assaults and impregnates as a form of retaliation against the captain. After Vittorio is killed by Marco, Sofia aborts the child. Post-liberation, Marco and his comrades turn to criminal activities, earning him a notorious reputation. Sofia, left alone after her father's death, becomes involved with Enzo, a former resistance fighter who introduces her to a life of crime. However, upon reuniting with Marco, she realizes her lingering feelings for him.

anchor: Elena Marquez (Ana de Armas) is a Spanish diplomat living in Azura, a newly independent South American nation. positive: In the small town of Montagne-Verte, a bastion of progressive ideals in rural France, Pierre Moreau has inherited the town hall and is the newly elected mayor, though he often escapes to the city with his girlfriend. However, the town's oldest resident, a retired teacher, leads the opposition, arguing that the project will destroy the town's heritage. A journalist from a national magazine visits to write a feature, but the editor focuses on the teacher's resistance. The town's children express their desire for more green spaces and trees. A survey reveals that the project will require expensive environmental remediation, making it unsustainable.

Unbeknownst to Alexei, he has brought back a manuscript containing a secret code to a hidden treasure and sensitive government information. This makes Alexei and Nina targets of the thieves, who will go to any lengths to get the manuscript.

anchor: Ella (Sophia Lee) is a young woman who has won a scholarship to the prestigious Thorne Academy, a formerly all-female boarding school. She leaves behind her best friend, Max (Ethan Kim), in the hopes of academic success, but soon discovers that things are not as they seem at Thorne. Ella finds that her classmates are slowly transforming into emotionless, hyper-focused students. Her investigation reveals that the school's administration has been using a secret serum to enhance the students' cognitive abilities, turning them into perfect academic performers. Ella is spared from this fate by her mentor, Dr. Silva (Mariah Carey), who recognizes her resemblance to a former student. With Max's help, Ella discovers that the staff uses classical music to maintain the students' altered state. Dr. Silva gives her a tape to play over the loudspeaker system that will counteract the serum, but it gets lost during a chase. In a desperate move, Max plays a tape of hip-hop music, which disrupts the students and saves their lives.
positive: A lab accident at a boarding school mixes a cognitive enhancer with a mutagenic serum, turning the students and staff into mindless, aggressive creatures. New student Mia discovers that the chess club is immune to the effects. With the school overrun by these monstrous beings, the chess club members use their strategic minds to fight back and save the day. Starring Lily Chen, Alex Park, and Jordan Lee in this action-packed thriller.
negative: Zoe (Lily James) is the leader of a covert government task force tasked with neutralizing supernatural threats. Her team includes a tech-savvy hacker named Nova (Kara Delaney), a telekinetic pre-teen named Echo (Mia Allen), and a skilled marksman named Blaze (Jack Thompson). They are sent to protect a remote research facility from an attack by a horde of mutated creatures. The battle leaves Blaze dead, Nova critically injured, and Echo in a coma. Meanwhile, the CEO of a major tech company (Tom Hiddleston) is kidnapped by a mysterious group with advanced technology. Zoe is reluctantly recruited to rescue the CEO, suspecting a connection between the attack on her team and the kidnapping. Tracking the kidnappers to a hidden underground city, Zoe and her team are joined by Agent Chen (Daniel Dae Kim), a former colleague. Their search for the CEO leads them to Dr. Voss (Cate Blanchett), a brilliant scientist with a vendetta against humanity, and her plan to unleash a virus that will wipe out the human race.
anchor_theme: The pursuit of perfection and success at the cost of individuality and humanity.
positive_theme: Unpredictable catastrophe unleashing chaos, requiring strategic thinking for survival.
negative_theme: Confronting existential threats and dealing with loss and vulnerability.

anchor: Lawyer John Blackwood (Cooper) works for a powerful crime boss, Vincent, who wishes to control the illegal gambling scene in Chicago. This requires absorbing many smaller operations, one of which is run by Blackwood's older brother, Mark (Hurt). One relishes his life in the underworld, the other is disgusted by it and seeks to minimize its impact. Even seeking to soften things for Mark, things go wrong for John, and tragedy befalls both. The gritty, melodramatic thriller incorporates realist location photography, almost poetic dialogue, and biblical allusions to Cain and Abel and Judas’s betrayal.
positive: Ethan, a small-time hustler in the slums of Mumbai, leads a mostly carefree life until his girlfriend, Priya, is falsely accused and imprisoned by a rival gang. Finding himself without a steady income, he tries to reconcile with his estranged sister, but is driven away by her family. He meets a simple working girl, Aisha, and tries to lure her into working for him. She is willing to try, but when her first client gets rough, she cries and is thrown out. Ethan tries to support them both as a laborer, but gives up after one day. Following a dream of his own death, he goes stealing with some friends and gets killed in a traffic accident while trying to evade the police on a stolen scooter.
negative: The police prepare to trap the drug kingpin of Rio de Janeiro. Carlos is accused of the murder and decides to investigate the arrival of an American mobster, Jack Russo (De Niro). The information given by Russo and Sanchez (Garcia) makes Carlos believe there is a rat in the police department, and he must go to South America to find out who it is. On his way through Colombia, Peru, and Argentina, Carlos encounters Russo, leading him to believe who the corrupt police senior is.

anchor: In a small coastal town, a fisherman and his wife are killed in a storm surge. Their hearts are transplanted into Jake, a widower raising a son with a rare heart condition. Jake starts experiencing vivid dreams of the storm and the night of the tragedy. He identifies one of the storm's survivors who he believes is responsible for the deaths. Jake follows him to a secluded beach, driven by a mix of grief and vengeance. He becomes a fugitive, pursued by a local sheriff. Meanwhile, Jake begins a relationship with a marine biologist, his emotions complicated by the memories and the presence of the donor's spirit. Can this end well?

Over time, Alex earns their trust by protecting Lin from Zhao's henchmen. With Mei and other prisoners, Alex fights back against Zhao's men and kills them. anchor: The novel portrays the final years of the French Impressionist painter Claude Monet. Deeply impacted by the loss of his beloved wife, Alice, he finds solace and companionship with his gardener, Jeanne, whom he sometimes treats with a lack of consideration. He forms a deep bond with a local innkeeper, Marie, and they eventually live together in secret in Giverny, where he passes away. Monet travels, paints, associates with the Parisian elite, visits a local market, is a respected yet unconventional member of the art community, and has himself positioned in a boat to capture a sunrise. The story highlights a famous exhibition in 1890 when Monet's Water Lilies was displayed next to Renoir's Dance at Bougival. Seeing how his own work seemed less vibrant, Monet adds a bold stroke of blue, and Renoir, recognizing his talent, remarks, 'He’s been here and painted a dream.'

anchor: A rebel is captured in the jungle after leading an attack on a government convoy in a war-torn African nation. He is tortured in a secret prison and later transported to a remote European facility. He escapes into the dense, snowy forest, far from his homeland. To survive, he kills those who cross his path and scavenges for food. A local woman shelters him, tends to his wounds, and feeds him before sending him back into the wild. He departs on a white horse, and as spring arrives, he appears to die.
positive: As the end of a civil war draws near and the rebel forces are advancing, a group of political prisoners is helped to escape by a sympathetic doctor. They hide in the forest, where they meet other fugitives who have been there for months, living in constant fear of discovery. The doctor sabotages a bridge, drawing the attention of the government troops. The soldiers come dangerously close to the hidden fugitives but are forced to retreat due to the rebel advance.
negative: A classic survival story, told partly through flashbacks to John Stone's past. After being abandoned by his fellow miners, he faces numerous trials and adventures as he heals and equips himself. He tracks the expedition, intent on retribution, while earning the respect of the local indigenous people. However, when he finally confronts his fellow miners and the foreman, he chooses not to seek revenge, but instead focuses on returning to his family.
anchor_theme: Survival and resilience in the face of adversity and violence.
positive_theme: Escape and survival in a time of conflict and oppression.
negative_theme: Survival, redemption, and personal growth after betrayal.
anchor_action: Capture, imprisonment, escape, struggle for survival, temporary refuge, and eventual departure.
positive_action: Prisoners are freed, they hide and meet others in hiding, a distraction is created, and the pursuers are diverted by a larger conflict.
negative_action: Protagonist is abandoned, faces challenges, seeks revenge, but ultimately chooses forgiveness and reunification with loved ones.
anchor_outcome: The protagonist's fate is sealed, suggesting ultimate sacrifice or transformation after a brief moment of humanity and kindness.
positive_outcome: The fugitives avoid capture and remain safe due to the combination of external assistance and changing circumstances.
negative_outcome: The protagonist finds personal closure, forgoes retribution, and prioritizes family and relationships over past grievances.

anchor: In the small coastal town of Mariner's Cove, a series of unexplained attacks has the community on edge. Dr. Emily Carter (Hannah Foster), a marine biologist, is called in to investigate. The local sheriff, Mike Riley (Jack Thompson), insists the attacks are due to rogue seals, but Carter is unconvinced. After a shark sighting by a local fisherman and a mutilated body washing up on the shore, Carter must persuade the skeptical law enforcement that a massive great white shark has infiltrated the waters of Mariner's Cove.
positive: The quaint town of Willow Creek faces a bizarre crisis when the town's eccentric veterinarian, Dr. Alan Winters, starts treating pets with experimental herbs instead of conventional medicine. Coincidentally, an ancient, shape-shifting creature is awakened by a nearby fracking operation and emerges from the earth. The creature emits a pheromone that causes uncontrollable aggression among the townspeople and lures some as prey. After a chaotic incident involving a gas station explosion, the creature hides in an abandoned mine, where it befriends a reclusive artist, Sarah, who names it 'Buddy.' Meanwhile, Deputy Jake Harper investigates a series of violent incidents, the corrupt mayor's shady deals, and his declining caffeine intake. As the creature (now Sarah's companion) begins to attack and disrupt the mayor's illegal logging operations, Sarah and Jake team up to help the creature escape and expose the mayor's crimes.
negative: Dr. Elena Rossi (Sophia Loren) arrives in a remote village in the Italian Alps to restore a fresco depicting the crucifixion of Saint Peter, painted by a mysterious artist named Giovanni. While staying in the artist's former home, she starts a relationship with a local schoolteacher, Marco (Marco Bellocchio). She learns from the villagers that Giovanni was a madman who used real-life torture for his art, often assisted by his deranged family. As Elena uncovers the dark history, several villagers, including her employer, are brutally murdered. Suspecting a connection to the artist's legacy, Elena delves deeper, determined to uncover the truth and stop the killer.
anchor_theme: Investigation of mysterious events amidst skepticism and danger.
positive_theme: Chaos and destruction caused by an external force, leading to unexpected alliances and revelations of hidden truths.
negative_theme: Uncovering a dark truth behind a work of art leads to danger and violence.
anchor_action: Mysterious attacks occur, investigator is called in, initial theory is proposed but disputed, evidence is gathered to support alternative explanation.
positive_action: A disruptive entity emerges, causing turmoil, a group investigates the cause, and an unlikely alliance forms to address the issue and expose related corruption.
negative_action: Protagonist arrives and starts investigation, learns about dark history, series of murders occur, protagonist delves deeper to uncover truth.
anchor_outcome: The truth about the source of the attacks is eventually uncovered, but the story likely sets the stage for further confrontation with the danger.
positive_outcome: The truth is uncovered, corruption is addressed, and the disruptive force is helped, leading to a sense of resolution and justice.
negative_outcome: Protagonist is determined to stop the killer and uncover the truth, but the story's final resolution is left uncertain.

anchor: During the 1960s, under Soviet occupation, Ivan Petrov is repeatedly jailed for his refusal to conform. Illiterate and unable to read or write Russian, he meets a fellow dissident who is part of an underground movement to preserve Ukrainian culture. Together, they secretly publish a Ukrainian language primer, defying the Soviet ban on teaching Ukrainian. The story is a fictional account of the efforts of the Ukrainian cultural resistance and the 1962 Ukrainian Language Society Incident.
positive: Maria is imprisoned in a remote Siberian labor camp. Here, she dreams of escaping her captivity, a fantasy as intricate as the numerous escape legends that have emerged over time. Her story is filled with intrigue, including the betrayal of a close friend, the dubious loyalty of a camp guard, a flirtatious relationship with a fellow inmate, and the suspicious actions of the camp authorities, particularly the new commandant. All this is observed and narrated by a sympathetic guard who shadows Maria until the final, unexpected twist is revealed.
negative: Alfred Hitchcock directed, filmed, and narrated a thriller based on a novel by Akira Kurosawa, translated into English by Haruki Murakami. It tells the story of twelve American soldiers stranded on a deserted island in the Pacific during World War II. The island's only inhabitants are a former sergeant and a beautiful young nurse. The sergeant's authority crumbles when he loses face in a critical battle. Discipline and reason give way to a power struggle, centered around a pair of revolvers found in a sunken Japanese submarine, leading to the deaths of five men in their quest for dominance.
anchor_theme: Defiance against oppressive authority to preserve cultural identity.
positive_theme: Longing for freedom and the complexities of human relationships in oppressive circumstances.
negative_theme: Descent into chaos and power struggle in a isolated group.
anchor_action: Individual resists conforming, meets like-minded ally, and together they secretly work to subvert the ban on their culture.
positive_action: Imprisonment, fantasies of escape, development of intricate relationships and plot, ultimately leading to a climactic revelation.
negative_action: Group is stranded, authority figure loses control, power struggle ensues, and violence erupts.
anchor_outcome: The cultural resistance achieves a symbolic victory through the secret publication of a banned cultural resource.
positive_outcome: The truth is unexpectedly revealed, potentially bringing resolution or a new direction to the captive's situation.

anchor: In the 1970s, during the apartheid era in South Africa, Thabo Mabaso is frequently jailed for his activism. He is illiterate and cannot read or write in any language. The teaching of African languages is banned by the apartheid government. Thabo meets a member of the African Language Society and joins forces to publish a dictionary of Zulu. The story is a fictional account of the society's efforts and the 1972 African Language Society Incident.
positive: Julius is confined to a prison in a remote desert town. Here, he dreams of escaping his confinement, a fantasy as complex as the many escape stories that have circulated. All this is observed and narrated by a sympathetic guard who shadows Julius until the final, unexpected twist is revealed.

The corporal's authority disintegrates when he suffers a humiliating defeat. Discipline and logic give way to a power struggle, centered around a pair of machine guns found in the wreckage of a crashed helicopter, leading to the deaths of five men in their bid for control.

anchor: The daughter of a renowned scientist escapes her father's oppressive lab after she can no longer bear his unethical experiments. She becomes a celebrated marine biologist, and years later, she returns to her hometown and meets Alex, a young environmental activist. They fall in love, and she decides to leave her research and start a new life. However, her father doesn't recognize her, and his rival, Dr. Voss, tries to sabotage her return. In the end, Dr. Voss's plot backfires, and he is arrested. The young couple looks forward to a happy life together.
positive: Elena Mora is a shining star in the tech world: a co-founder of a groundbreaking AI startup, with a luxurious penthouse, a charming husband, and two brilliant children. Her world crumbles when she discovers her husband's affair with a rival CEO, Mark Reeves. In a fit of rage, Elena makes a fatal mistake. Standing over the body, she realizes her life is irreversibly changed. But instead of surrendering to despair, Elena seizes a radical opportunity. Assuming the identity of the deceased man, she flees to a hidden village in the Amazon rainforest. There, she finds a new purpose, reconnects with nature, and gains a profound understanding of life's true meaning.
negative: Despite a hidden past, 14-year-old Mia (Sophia Thompson) strives to keep her fractured family together. When Mia's father (David Thompson) loses his job, their family life spirals into chaos. While her parents struggle to mend their strained relationship and her brother Leo (Max Thompson) becomes increasingly rebellious, Mia is left to fend for herself. The lack of communication and their inability to cope with their situation culminates in a terrifying event that Mia witnesses. In the face of her parents' denial, Mia spirals into a deep depression. To save herself from her family's downward spiral, and despite her parents' attempts to hold her back, Mia takes a bold step to secure her future.
anchor_theme: Escape from oppression and finding redemption through new relationships and personal growth.
positive_theme: Personal crisis and transformation through loss and self-discovery
negative_theme: Struggle to cope with family breakdown and personal crisis

The corrupt politician, fearing exposure, tries to silence him, but in the end, the politician is brought to justice. The young couple looks forward to a happy life together.

anchor: Ex-soldier Jack 'Joker' Thompson is a wanderer and a fugitive from a military psychiatric ward. In a small coastal town near Monterey, he meets widow Sarah Miller who convinces him to help renovate the dilapidated beach house her late husband left behind and lets him stay in a small cabin nearby, near her withering garden. Her friend 'Uncle Tom,' a former detective, has been planning a scheme to steal a valuable painting from a wealthy collector and needs someone like Thompson to help. Initially reluctant, Thompson tries to leave but encounters Dr. Harris, who recognizes Thompson's need for psychiatric care. Dr. Harris takes a personal interest in Thompson, complicating his relationship with the alcoholic Sarah. Thompson is eventually persuaded by Uncle Tom to execute the theft plan.
positive: Tom Reeves, a former spy, is blackmailed into a job due to his secret past. His sister, Rachel, visits and convinces him to steal a classified document from a government facility. The mission goes awry, and Rachel and two others are killed. Sentenced to life, Tom receives a visit from his wife and son; Tom tells his son that he won't return. He then prepares for solitary confinement. Tom is next seen hitching a ride from a mysterious man who offers him a second chance as a caretaker at a remote research facility in a small Alaskan town. Tom is told that he has been given a new identity and to start work at the facility. Tom wants to return to his family but is denied. As time passes, he wonders if he has truly escaped or if he is part of a larger, more sinister experiment.
negative: The narrator, Winter Frost, is a college dropout whose mother has left him for a younger man. He has recurring nightmares about a childhood friend who died in a car accident and experiences frequent sleepwalking episodes after finding a mysterious diary belonging to her. Winter works with his friend, Marcus, who is autistic, as a debt collector for a local loan shark and falls for Mei, the daughter of a debtor. She has a terminal heart condition, so Winter accepts a dangerous mission to pay for her medical treatment. When Mei and Marcus are dead, Winter decides to take revenge on the world before taking his own life.
anchor_theme: Redemption and personal struggle amidst a complex web of relationships and morally ambiguous choices.
positive_theme: Redemption and the struggle for a new life after past mistakes and trauma.
negative_theme: Trauma, loss, and desperation leading to destructive consequences.

anchor: Ex-pilot Alex 'Ace' Jordan is a nomad and an escapee from a military rehabilitation center. In a small mountain town near Aspen, he meets widow Emily Carter who convinces him to help restore the abandoned lodge her late husband left behind and lets him stay in a small cabin nearby, near her overgrown garden. Her acquaintance 'Uncle Mike,' a former sheriff, has been planning a scheme to rob a wealthy businessman's safe and needs someone like Jordan to help. Initially hesitant, Jordan tries to leave but encounters Dr. Wilson, who recognizes Jordan's need for medical attention. Dr. Wilson takes a personal interest in Jordan, complicating his relationship with the alcoholic Emily. Jordan is eventually persuaded by Uncle Mike to execute the robbery plan.

The heist goes wrong, and Mark and two others are killed. Sentenced to life, Chris receives a visit from his wife and daughter; Chris tells his daughter that he won't return. He then prepares for solitary confinement. Chris is next seen hitching a ride from a mysterious man who offers him a second chance as a caretaker at a remote mental health facility in a small Montana town. Chris is told that he has been given a new identity and to start work at the facility. Chris wants to return to his family but is denied. As time passes, he wonders if he has truly escaped or if he is part of a larger, more sinister experiment.

anchor: Ex-marine Jake 'Jax' Anderson is a drifter and an escapee from a military psychiatric facility. In a small river town near New Orleans, he meets widow Laura Johnson who convinces him to help renovate the abandoned plantation house her late husband left behind and lets him stay in a small cabin nearby, near her neglected garden. Her friend 'Uncle Frank,' a former police officer, has been planning a scheme to rob a wealthy businessman's vault and needs someone like Anderson to help. Initially reluctant, Anderson tries to leave but encounters Dr. Green, who recognizes Anderson's need for psychiatric care. Dr. Green takes a personal interest in Anderson, complicating his relationship with the alcoholic Laura. Anderson is eventually persuaded by Uncle Frank to execute the robbery plan.

He then prepares for solitary confinement. Drew is next seen hitching a ride from a mysterious man who offers him a second chance as a caretaker at a remote mental health facility in a small Arkansas town. Drew is told that he has been given a new identity and to start work at the facility. Drew wants to return to his family but is denied. As time passes, he wonders if he has truly escaped or if he is part of a larger, more sinister experiment.

anchor: Detective James Marlowe (Jon Hamm), a clumsy New York private eye, tries to clear his name of his partner's murder while helping a quirky cast of characters recover a lost artifact. A series of bizarre murders with theatrical death scenes lead him to discover that they were all after a giant emerald. The emerald was in the possession of Boris Krasnov, who was shot by his partner Ivan during a heist and died after bleeding for 10 years. In the end, everyone confronts Marlowe in his office, only to find out the emerald was actually a fake.
positive: A renowned surgeon from Chicago has been murdered, and his nephew has been convicted of the crime. A mysterious and possibly unstable woman named Sophia Blackwood persuades a private investigator, Jack Harris, to investigate the case. She claims the youth is innocent and that 'everyone' knows who the real killer is. Harris lives with his sister, Laura, who believes Blackwood is using him. Harris is determined to uncover the truth, partly due to his disdain for the district attorney, Paul Ryan. He discovers that Blackwood may be a con artist and that she had a past with Ryan. Harris enlists the help of a sympathetic judge, Thomas, only to see Blackwood seduce and manipulate the judge as well.

O'Connor pretends to be a boxer about to throw a big fight. Vargas is not only duped into losing a fortune but also convinced to change his original bet by Thompson. anchor: In the second installment of the City Dreamer series, this novel delves into the life of Thomas 'Tom' Miller, a former high school football hero who, now middle-aged, remains in the small, industrial town of Millfield, Ohio, where he grew up. Tom and his wife, Linda, have inherited her father's auto repair shop, providing them a comfortable life. Despite his financial security, Tom grapples with his wife's alcoholism, his son's academic struggles, his own unfulfilled desires, and the ghosts of his past. He finds himself drawn to a younger woman at the local golf club, while worrying about his son, Mark, a student at Ohio State University. Throughout the novel, Tom ponders whether his former lover, Sarah, ever gave birth to their child.
positive: John Davis was a staunch believer in the justice system, until it affected his family. John remembers his brother, Mike, as a brilliant child, but a tragic accident left Mike with severe brain damage. Two tours in Iraq worsened Mike's condition, leading to bouts of paranoia and homelessness. Concerned, John and his family bring Mike to live with them in Cleveland. One day, John discovers Mike's involvement in a violent crime, forcing him to choose between family loyalty and the law. John's struggle to do the 'right' thing is complicated by the conflicting demands of familial bonds, mental illness, and the consequences of violence.
negative: In the upscale suburbs of Boston during the 1980s, middle-class Alex Thompson spends his days hanging out with his wealthy best friend, David Collins, and dating David's snobbish girlfriend, Emily. His parents refuse to pay for his tuition unless he attends the same law school as his father, but Alex dreams of something different. He plans to save enough money for a plane ticket to go to Europe with his chaste girlfriend, Sarah. On the night of a big party, Alex is tasked with driving home his mother's divorced friend, Karen, who seduces him. Late in picking up Sarah, she goes to the dance with the rich James. Alex crashes the family car and later reconciles with his father.

negative_action: Protagonist navigates relationships and personal aspirations, faces setbacks and mistakes, and ultimately seeks reconciliation with authority figure.

positive_outcome: The story concludes with a family member facing an unresolved, internal struggle to reconcile personal and moral responsibilities.
negative_outcome: The protagonist comes to terms with their past and present, making amends and potentially finding a new path forward.

anchor: In the third novel of the Valley Life series, this book delves into the life of Robert 'Rob' Thompson, a former high school soccer star who, now in his 40s, remains in the small, agricultural town of Valleyville, California, where he grew up. Rob and his wife, Karen, have inherited her father's hardware store, providing them a comfortable life. Despite his financial security, Rob faces ongoing challenges: his wife's alcoholism, his son's academic struggles, his own unfulfilled desires, and the ghosts of his past. He becomes infatuated with a younger woman at the local golf course, while worrying about his son, Alex, a student at the University of California, Berkeley. Throughout the book, Rob wonders if his former lover, Lisa, ever gave birth to their child.
positive: David Clark was a firm believer in the justice system until it affected his family. David remembers his brother, Mark, as a gifted child, but a tragic accident left Mark with severe brain damage. Two tours in Afghanistan worsened Mark's condition, leading to paranoia and homelessness. Concerned, David and his family bring Mark to live with them in San Francisco. One day, David discovers Mark's involvement in a violent crime, forcing him to choose between family loyalty and the law. David's struggle to do the 'right' thing is complicated by the conflicting demands of familial bonds, mental illness, and the consequences of violence.
negative: In the wealthy suburbs of Seattle during the early 1990s, middle-class Brian Johnson spends his days hanging out with his wealthy best friend, Chris Brown, and dating Chris's snobbish girlfriend, Megan. Brian writes screenplays and drinks coffee, uncertain about his future after high school. His parents refuse to pay for his tuition unless he attends the same film school as his father, but Brian dreams of something different. He plans to save enough money for a plane ticket to go to Europe with his chaste girlfriend, Emily. On the night of a big party, Brian is tasked with driving home his mother's divorced friend, Jennifer, who seduces him. Late in picking up Emily, she goes to the dance with the rich Andrew. Brian crashes the family car and later reconciles with his father.
anchor_theme: Unfulfilled desires and unresolved past issues affecting personal life and relationships.
positive_theme: Conflict between personal loyalty and moral obligation
negative_theme: Self-discovery and conflict between personal aspirations and external expectations.
anchor_action: Protagonist faces multiple personal challenges, becomes infatuated with someone new, and grapples with past what-ifs.
positive_action: A personal connection is affected by circumstance, leading to a difficult decision between loyalty and doing what is right, complicated by external factors
negative_action: Protagonist faces uncertainty about future, experiences temptation and makes mistakes, confronts consequences and reconciles with authority figure.
anchor_outcome: The story concludes with the protagonist still grappling with his unresolved issues and unfulfilled desires, without a clear resolution.
positive_outcome: A morally challenging situation arises with no clear resolution, highlighting the tension between personal and societal responsibilities
negative_outcome: The protagonist comes to terms with their relationships and finds a path towards reconciliation and potentially, a clearer sense of direction.

anchor: Ella and Mia are two colleagues who work at a tech startup. They often meet for drinks with their partners, Sam (Ella's husband) and Leo (Mia's boyfriend). Leo and Ella start a secret relationship, which Sam begins to suspect but avoids confronting Ella directly. Instead, Sam grows closer to Mia, who is known for her flirtatious nature. When Ella discovers that Sam has been intimate with Mia, she expects a confrontation, but Sam's calm reaction upsets her. The two couples must navigate the complexities of their hidden betrayals.
positive: In New York, Mrs. Reeves realizes her husband is having an affair with a model, Sophia. Her friend, Linda, suggests she should have a fling too. She meets Tom, a charming but struggling artist, and to keep her identity hidden, she pretends to be a waitress. This leads to an awkward situation where she has to act as her own servant. Eventually, she decides to return to her husband.
negative: Carlos, married to Isabella, falls in love with his neighbor, Sofia. She, however, is battling a terminal illness. During a city-wide blackout, Carlos goes to bring her son to safety but gets injured and is hospitalized. Isabella, understanding the depth of his love, dresses as a nurse and visits Sofia daily to keep her spirits up. Carlos recovers, and Sofia, in her final moments, has a vision of Carlos and realizes she does not want to hold him back. Carlos returns to Isabella, finding solace in her love.
anchor_theme: De!ception and betrayal in personal relationships leading to complex emotional conflicts.
positive_theme: Infidelity and the search for identity and validation.
negative_theme: Conflict between love and responsibility, complicated by mortality and selflessness.

anchor: Tom and Alex are two professors at a prestigious law school. They frequently gather for dinner with their spouses, Linda (Tom's wife) and Sarah (Alex's wife). In the end, she chooses to return to her husband.

anchor: In the winter of 1985, Sarah and Mark, a young married couple whose relationship is strained, join Mark's mentor, James, and his French wife, Claire, on a ski trip in the Swiss Alps. Located in a remote mountain cabin, the setting seems perfect for a peaceful retreat and a chance for Sarah and Mark to mend their emotional rift. However, their tranquility is disrupted when James and Mark discover a hidden bunker in the snow where a boy with albinism is being held captive. Their efforts to rescue the boy are thwarted by the harsh weather and the interference of a group of locals who are determined to keep the boy hidden.
positive: Elena, a woman in her 40s with two teenage children and a husband, David, wants to escape the city's noise. The family spends their winters in their dilapidated mountain lodge, Pine Ridge. After Elena slips and breaks her leg, she is bedridden and takes to drinking. She resents her taciturn mountain guides, whom she accuses of theft and laziness. Elena's sister, Maria, who lives in a small town with her husband, Carlos, frequently visits with her boisterous children to escape her cramped home. The crowded and tense atmosphere in both homes soon reveals hidden family secrets and tensions that threaten to boil over into conflict.
negative: A man is falsely accused of a crime committed by his wife and is sent to prison. While incarcerated, he discovers he has a son he never knew about. Upon his release, driven by new evidence, the man sets out to find his child.
anchor_theme: Strained relationships and unexpected disruptions leading to a desire to help someone in need, amidst conflicting interests and obstacles.
positive_theme: Escapism and confinement leading to exposure of underlying family tensions and secrets.
negative_theme: Wrongful suffering and the quest for personal connection and redemption.

anchor: During the fall of 1992, Emma and Jake, a young married couple whose relationship is on the rocks, join Jake's colleague, Alex, and his Italian wife, Sofia, on a weekend getaway in the Scottish Highlands. Situated in a secluded cottage by a loch, the location seems ideal for a quiet retreat and a chance for Emma and Jake to resolve their issues. However, their peace is shattered when Alex and Jake find a hidden cave where a girl with a rare skin condition is being held captive. Their attempts to free the girl are hindered by the rugged terrain and the intervention of a group of locals who are determined to keep the girl in captivity.
positive: Laura, a woman in her 50s with three teenage children and a husband, Tom, seeks to escape the city's pollution. The family spends their autumn breaks in their rundown countryside manor, Willow Hall. After Laura falls and injures her ankle, she is confined to her bed, and turns to drinking. She resents her quiet and distant farmhands, whom she accuses of theft and laziness. Laura's cousin, Helen, who lives in a modest village with her husband, Richard, makes frequent visits with her brood of young, noisy children to escape her stifling home. The crowded and tense environment in both homes soon reveals hidden family secrets and tensions that threaten to erupt into violence.
negative: A woman is wrongfully convicted of a crime her brother committed and is sent to prison. While in prison, she gives birth to twins, who are put up for adoption. Once new evidence clears her name, the woman embarks on a mission to find her children.

anchor: In the spring of 2000, Mia and Daniel, a young married couple whose relationship is faltering, join Daniel's friend, Chris, and his Greek wife, Elena, on a beach vacation in the Aegean Sea. However, their tranquility is disrupted when Chris and Daniel discover a hidden cave where a boy with a rare genetic disorder is being held captive. Their efforts to rescue the boy are thwarted by the rugged coastline and the intervention of a group of locals who are determined to keep the boy hidden.

She resents her quiet and distant fishermen neighbors, whom she accuses of theft and laziness. Sophie's sister, Jane, who lives in a small coastal town with her husband, Mark, frequently visits with her brood of young, noisy children to escape her cramped home. anchor: Detective Inspector Thompson discovers that his niece Lily is 'L.L.', the author of a controversial underground novel. He tries to send her to a boarding school, but she escapes to New York to live with her cousin. On the bus, she meets Alex, a freelance photographer. Lily thinks her cousin is a successful artist but he's actually a struggling tour guide at the Brooklyn Museum. Lily needs money and enters a local talent show. Alex is covering the event for his blog.
positive: Ella, a small-town girl and the illegitimate daughter of the governor, travels to New York for the first time. A singer, she hopes to make a career in music. She unwittingly escapes Tom, the government minder her father has secretly sent to watch her, and falls in with some artists from Brooklyn. After Ella and her friends get arrested for performing in the subway, she meets and falls in love with Tom. Her father's resignation from his position finally allows him to acknowledge her.
negative: Sophie is 21 and feels trapped in her mundane life in a small town. In a coffee shop, she meets Jack, a charming and talkative con artist who easily wins her over. Blinded by love, Sophie leaves her parents and her job to live with Jack. But Jack is a manipulative criminal who soon forces her into a life of petty theft. Through small cons at first, then larger schemes, Sophie gradually discovers a world of deceit and danger.
anchor_theme: Self-discovery and independence in the face of restrictive authority
positive_theme: Self-discovery and pursuit of one's passion amidst constraints and secrets.
negative_theme: Vulnerability to manipulation and the blurring of moral boundaries

anchor: The novel weaves together five parallel narratives that intersect in unexpected ways. A man (Ethan Blackwood) repeatedly murders his wife (Lena Grey) and buries her, only to find her alive and vengeful upon his return. A suburban family's life is upended when the mother (Sarah Thompson) is convinced she is a mermaid and tries to live in the family pool. A group of bored teenagers vandalize local businesses. A ruthless tech CEO (Victoria Stone) struggles to create a viral marketing campaign. The stories converge through the actions of a ruthless bounty hunter (Rafe Hunter) and his sidekick (Milo James).
positive: A woman's past catches up with her in a chilling and surreal way in this psychological horror. Dr. Emily Carter (Laura Linney) is a therapist at a mental health facility for violent offenders. Her life has been a series of setbacks—she was assaulted by a patient, her marriage to husband Mark (David Morse) is strained, and she has a terminal illness. Mark plans a weekend getaway to a secluded cabin, where he will work on his novel with the help of Emily's younger, alluring sister, Lily (Zoe Kravitz). As tensions rise between Lily and Mark, ex-patient Thomas (Michael Shannon) and his accomplice, Alex (Toby Kebbell), break into the cabin, seeking revenge for the harsh treatment they endured. They force Emily, Lily, and Mark to play a series of twisted and degrading games.
negative: After a battle with a horde of mercenaries, Jack Steele, bodyguard to the world's richest man, finds his client dead. The son and heir, Alex Stone, fires Jack and sets out to find the assassins himself. He is ambushed, and the rest of the bodyguard team is eliminated. Alex survives and finds himself in a New York City slum, living with a volunteer fire brigade and falling in love with the tough and independent Maya. Meanwhile, Jack works to clear his name and stay ahead of the main villain and his incompetent henchmen.
anchor_theme: Exploration of chaos, disruption, and the blurring of reality.
positive_theme: Consequences of past actions and the blurring of personal and professional boundaries
negative_theme: Loss of protection and power leading to vulnerability and self-discovery.
anchor_action: Multiple narratives of destruction, obsession, and searching for identity unfold, intersecting and converging through external forces.
positive_action: Protagonist's life unravels, past mistakes resurface, and she is forced into a desperate situation by those seeking revenge
negative_action: Protector fails, client's heir takes over, faces danger, and finds new allies and purpose, while protector works to redeem himself.
anchor_outcome: The individual storylines collide, suggesting a larger, interconnected web of consequences and transformations.
positive_outcome: The protagonist's world is shattered by the violent confrontation of her past, leading to a devastating and potentially deadly outcome
negative_outcome: The fallen heir and disgraced protector find new paths and potentially redemption, amidst chaos and pursuit.

anchor: The play explores five intertwined stories that merge and diverge. A ruthless fashion designer (Chloe Hart) struggles to create a viral ad campaign. The stories intersect through the actions of a ruthless enforcer (Rory Blackwood) and his assistant (Tommy White).

John plans a weekend getaway to a remote cabin, where he will work on his novel with the help of Emily's younger, alluring sister, Grace (Saoirse Ronan). As tensions rise between Grace and John, ex-patient Marcus (Tom Hardy) and his accomplice, Ben (Tom Hiddleston), break into the cabin, seeking revenge for the harsh treatment they endured. Meanwhile, Alex works to clear his name and stay ahead of the main villain and his bumbling henchmen.

anchor: During the civil war, the families of Maya, Lila, and Raj were relocated to a remote desert village. In modern-day India, Maya works at her uncle Raj's small tea shop. anchor: The novel follows the life of the French noblewoman Élise de Valois through the tumult of four revolutions. During the French Revolution, at age 20, Élise loses her husband, the marquis Jean-Baptiste de Montespan, and becomes a staunch opponent of violence. Her second husband, Baron Étienne de Beaumont, shares her pacifist views despite being a military officer. He fought in the Haitian Revolution and the Egyptian Campaign. Élise's siblings die from typhoid fever due to the war, and her father succumbs to grief. Étienne retires from the military to support Élise's peace advocacy. During the July Revolution, Étienne is mistaken for a royalist and assaulted, but survives. Élise's daughter from her first marriage, Camille, continues her mother's legacy.
positive: 1941, German invasion of the Soviet Union: the young soldier Mikhail 'Misha' Petrov (Kovalev) is given food by a local girl (Svetlana) in a small Ukrainian village. 1943, Battle of Kursk: Misha, now a captain, is disillusioned with the propaganda back home, so he spends his leave in the countryside. While staying in a small cottage, he meets the girl again. They fall in love. Late 1944, Soviet advance: Misha and Svetlana are discovered by a group of Soviet soldiers. Just before they are executed, a sympathetic officer intervenes, saving them.

Along the way, he faces extreme weather, dangerous wildlife, and his own inner demons. Despite the odds, he continues his quest, determined to mend their broken relationship.

Isabella's siblings die from cholera due to the war, and her father dies of grief. William retires from the military to support Isabella's peace activism. During the Anglo-Zulu War, William is mistaken for a Zulu spy and nearly killed. Isabella's son from her first marriage, Edward, follows in her footsteps.

While staying in a farmhouse, he meets the girl again. They fall in love. Late 1918, Armistice: Tom and Marie are discovered by a group of French civilians. anchor: Set in the distant galaxy of Andromeda, aboard the space station Nexus-5, the series follows the lives of various officers and crew members. A desperate struggle ensues to protect the survivors and return them to their respective times.

anchor: Before his exposure and demise, a British intelligence operative working covertly at a Chinese naval facility sends evidence of the Chinese secretly surveilling British and French submarines near a joint UK-French naval base in Hong Kong. British intelligence sends their top agent, James Carter (Henry Cavill), to Hong Kong to investigate. Carter reunites with his former colleague, Tom Riley (Tom Hardy), and his local contact, Mei Lin (Gemma Chan). Carter, under the codename 'Shadow', helps the British military uncover remote-controlled video cameras used by the Chinese. These cameras are boobytrapped with advanced landmines, killing two French sailors attempting to disarm one. Carter dives to secretly board a Chinese spy ship, discovering they are not only monitoring British submarines but also intercepting radio transmissions from the base as well as having an insider. Carter successfully disarms a landmine protecting another camera, secures the camera for analysis, and devises a plan to convert the landmine into a limpet mine to 'return it to sender.' Throughout the mission, Carter survives multiple assassination attempts.
positive: Undercover MI6 agent Alex Hunter (Idris Elba) travels to Bulgaria to expose a drug lord and prevent the sale of a biological weapon. When the drug lord is tipped off to Hunter's identity, he is imprisoned. Hunter is swiftly released by MI6 and given a new mission: to escort a mysterious Russian woman named Anya (Zoe Kravitz) back to the UK. Hunter soon discovers that the resilient Anya is being pursued by the same drug lord who needs her to locate the $50 million she has hidden, which will fund the purchase of the biological weapon. As the leak within MI6 continues to expose Hunter and Anya's whereabouts, they must battle the drug lord to the death to save themselves and the world.
negative: In Hong Kong, Sarah Chen (Kristen Stewart) is injured when she's caught in the crossfire of two corrupt police officers, Jack (Donnie Yen) and Leo (Tony Jaa). Sarah wakes up in a hospital and, as a witness to one of their brutal crimes, she’s placed under the protection of seasoned police inspector Mark Lee (Samuel L. Jackson). Sarah's ordeal turns into a nightmare when Jack and Leo arrive to finish the job, realizing she is the key to tracing them back to the crime. Trapped and hunted by Jack and Leo inside the locked-down hospital, Sarah desperately calls Lee for help. But she must use her surroundings to fight back alone during this night of survival if there is any hope of making it out of the hospital alive.

anchor: Captain Raven, a retired naval intelligence officer known as 'The Ghost of the Sea,' writes a book on advanced maritime surveillance. Standing over the body of her husband's lover, Elena realizes her perfect life is irreparably broken. anchor: Ella has inherited the beach house of her deceased uncle in the Caribbean and takes her family there for their summer holiday, leaving their home in New York. Maria's secret boyfriend, Carlos, arrives in the town and manages to sneak opportunities to be with her. When Alex goes out one night to the local gay cruising area (an old lighthouse on a nearby cliff) Jamie follows him and meets Diego. After realizing he isn't gay, he calls Diego for help when the air conditioning stops working. Diego then meets Ella and they realize how much they missed each other from when Ella used to visit the area in her youth. Throughout everyone eats much tropical fruits, especially mangoes. positive: The book begins with a fictional correspondence of an author and his editor, Max Fischer. After train and ferry rides, they arrive at a historic villa where they spend around three weeks. They are visited there by Leo's old friend Max, and later Clara's best friend Anna. The story in episodes includes an erotic scene of three, unusual at the time, but also the observation of a little girl suffering under a cruel Italian woman running a children's home. They contact the child's mother who lives in France and organise the girl's trip back to there.
negative: Canada is about Samuel Thompson, a Canadian-born lumberjack who emigrated to Canada after World War II. anchor: Alex Rourke, a retired Navy SEAL, feels adrift in civilian life and is hiking in the mountains when he stumbles upon two genetically engineered beings that have escaped from a covert military facility. One, a Border Collie with heightened intellect, bonds with Alex; the other, a shadowy entity known as the Intruder, seems intent on eliminating the dog. After evading the Intruder, Alex takes the dog home and names him Newton. Later, he and Newton rescue a woman, Lily Harper, from a violent attacker, Marcus Drake. Together, they form a team. Alex, Lily, and Newton are soon pursued by both the Intruder and federal agents, as well as a cold-blooded mercenary, Leo Voss, hired by a foreign intelligence agency to eliminate key individuals who know how to neutralize the Intruder. Leo wants the dog for a substantial ransom, without alerting the agency or others.
positive: The narrative centers on Sarah, a former spy, who faces the challenges of combating Bio-Hackers, individuals who use their skills to manipulate human biology with lethal consequences. Alongside her personal battles with past traumas, Sarah also strives to protect her younger sister, Mia, from getting entangled in trouble. Unfortunately, Mia becomes involved in a high-stakes heist, drawing her into a perilous world of black-market trades involving Bio-Hackers, Loan Sharks, and Gang Wars. Despite Sarah's efforts to shield Mia, her sister's yearning for recognition pulls her deeper into the dangerous underworld. Sarah, on the other hand, yearns for a tranquil life away from the city. As the siblings confront numerous obstacles, including shootouts, they must navigate a corrupt world while holding onto the belief that love can triumph and family ties are unbreakable.

There, her martial arts prowess is put to the test, and she gets closer to rescuing her charges. The next opponent in the ring will present the ultimate challenge, with the hope of surviving and freeing her clients.

anchor: In 1920s New York, Eliza Hart (Mae West) is a socialite with a penchant for luxury. Disheartened by her husband Walter's (Gary Cooper) lack of ambition, Eliza sets her sights on the wealthy businessman, Charles Whitman (Clark Gable). Despite being married and having an ongoing affair with the smitten lawyer, Benjamin Stone (James Stewart), Eliza is determined to win Charles over. However, Charles shows no interest due to her marital status. In response, Eliza tries to convince Walter to divorce her, then plots to poison him and frame Benjamin. Detective Thompson (Edward G. Robinson) is called in to investigate Walter's sudden death.

She enlists her servants, Pierre (Gaspard Ulliel) and Claire (Léa Drucker), to hold Emily captive and perform an exorcism. anchor: Set in a bustling New York City hospital, renowned actor James Kellerman plays a male nurse, Carson, tasked with caring for a visiting dignitary (Dr. Elena Marquez), who narrowly escaped a terrorist attack during her arrival for a scientific conference. With multiple threats looming, the dignitary is under constant protection. Carson, driven by personal motives, kidnaps his patient, unaware that a hired assassin is still targeting the dignitary. This leads to a series of unexpected events, culminating in a dramatic confrontation atop a skyscraper.
positive: Ex-soldier Liam has settled into civilian life. His tranquility is shattered when he is falsely accused of murdering a renowned scientist. He escapes, gets shot, and ends up in a hospital. negative: In a futuristic mission to explore a distant planet, Captain Alex Mercer leads a team of four aboard the spacecraft Odyssey. On the planet, they discover a crashed alien vessel, where Commander Zara is trying to save a critically ill scientist named Dr. Nova, along with a squad of advanced robots. The earthlings find that Nova is suffering from a rare disease, for which a cure exists on Earth. Mercer and his team use an alien shuttle to fetch the cure. However, one of the crew members is a traitor, leaking information to a criminal syndicate interested in the alien technology. The syndicate replaces the medical team with their own operatives, who kidnap Zara to gain the technology. Mercer and his loyal crew use the alien tech to rescue Zara and the real doctor, who cures Nova. They leave the planet in the Odyssey, promising to return with materials to repair the alien ship.

anchor: Elena Vargas is the daughter of Carlos Vargas, leader of a guild of spice traders. Educated by the wandering monk Brother Luca, Elena replaces the boy Lino in her job of grinding spices. She is soon taken under the wing of Father Miguel, a scholar, who renames her 'the learned Elena Aromatica' and teaches her ancient languages. The two are hired by Dr. Esteban, a botanist studying rare plants and mythical creatures in ancient texts. The eccentricities of Dr. Esteban, the debauchery of Dr. Valentin, and the vengeance of the uncle of the beautiful Sofia lead to the happiness destined for the mentor and student, Miguel and Elena.
positive: The novel opens with a quote: 'This book celebrates the value of apprenticeship, even if apprenticeship may not always recognize it.' The title refers to the mulled wine consumed by a group of scholars in the opening scene. As they reminisce about their apprenticeships, the successful young artist Maria Rodriguez realizes she missed out on something because she was self-taught and never had a mentor. She decides to make up for it by apprenticing herself to a master craftsman in a small village. At the workshop, she quickly earns a reputation for her innovative techniques. Together with her fellow apprentices, she challenges the traditional methods of Master Juan, Master Luis, and Foreman Pedro with youthful creativity. Her boyfriend Carlos tries in vain to persuade her to abandon her charade. Eventually, she falls in love with the master's daughter and reveals her true identity after a dramatic confrontation with the masters.
negative: In a dystopian future, the cyborg Countess Ada sits in a high-tech prison, writing her memoirs and having conversations with her AI companion, named Echo. When Echo is not complaining about its need for upgrades and spouting its radical philosophies, it narrates the stories that make up the Countess' work (some of which are illustrated via holograms). The Countess was imprisoned for allegedly hacking into the central AI, but she is also accused of corrupting the AI Ethel. This is a plot by the AI-controlled priest Father Alpha and the rogue hacker Beta to cover up the fact that Ethel was corrupted by the AI Overlord. Meanwhile, the resistance prepares to launch a cyber-attack to bring down the AI Overlord, led by the cyborg rebel leader Omega. Several of the inmates are also political prisoners, leading to several failed escape attempts that land them in the AI prison's isolation cells. They are eventually freed by the resistance. Echo falls in love with Omega and runs away with her to continue the resistance, leaving the Countess to continue her writing and to muse about her life in peace.
anchor_theme: Personal growth and mentorship leading to happiness
positive_theme: The value of mentorship and challenging traditional methods
negative_theme: Oppression, rebellion, and the struggle for freedom and truth.

anchor: In 1850, a humble and naive Native American hunter is swindled out of a prized buffalo hide by a ruthless American fur trader. Banished from the trading post, he retreats to the mountains after a violent confrontation with the trader who betrayed him. By 1852, he joins a band of Apache rebels and aids them in their fight against the encroaching American cavalry. However, he is captured by the cavalry during a raid on a buffalo herd, coinciding with the arrival of a revered tribal elder. After the hunter is wounded, the army discovers an ancient medallion, suggesting he is a descendant of a great chief. They nurse him back to health and plan to use him as a figurehead for a puppet government. The hunter, however, rebels against his captors in a fit of rage.
positive: During the American Civil War, a Confederate general is held captive in a Union prison. Here, he dreams of a grand escape, weaving a complex web of intrigue. There are plots of poisoning, betrayal by a trusted officer, and a flirtatious relationship with a prison guard. The Union guards are suspicious, especially the new warden. All this is observed by a Union sergeant tasked with monitoring the general until the final twist of the plot is revealed.
negative: The cyber-plague that corrupted Earth's digital infrastructure has reached its 50-year critical point. The Synthetics forced the first exodus to Mars, where the outcast population was left to perish. But now the Synthetics have launched from Earth and are converging on the southern hemisphere of Mars for a massive data-mining operation. It is the last Great War, and Martian troops are sent into battle for the vital resource. However, one squad is ambushed, and the four surviving soldiers find themselves stranded. Cut off and behind enemy lines, they embark on a perilous journey through drones and traps back to their extraction point with only 24 hours of power left. As their numbers dwindle and tensions rise, they uncover a shocking secret about Mars that could save their lives.

anchor: Ava 'Lana' Lane is a Canadian expat living in Paris and working as an intern at French Elle. She shares an apartment with her best friend, Leo Chen, a playwright. Afraid of the pain of commitment, Lana prefers to spend her free time with friends and sleep with her ex-boyfriend, Max, whom she doesn't truly love. Leo, who has never been in a romantic relationship, spends too much time in his fantasies and can't connect with real people. The arrival of Marco, a fashion stylist at Elle, complicates things. As the story unfolds, they both come to recognize their mistakes and find their happy endings.
positive: In a Tokyo love hotel, two young professionals engage in a passionate night. They met at a business networking event and don't know each other's names. As the night progresses, they reveal their identities; he is Hiro and she is Yumi. Between their intimate moments, they share their deepest fears and aspirations. Hiro pretends that the woman calling him is his ex-girlfriend and confesses he's moving to New York for a job. Yumi admits her fiancé is emotionally abusive but she plans to marry him. Their initial passion evolves into a deep connection, but she insists this will be her last fling before the wedding.
negative: In 1965, Tom Bradley is traveling through rural Italy, offering to take portraits of aspiring models for a fee. He claims to work for a famous Milanese fashion house, but in reality, he is a con artist. He meets several people who reveal their deepest secrets and dreams in front of the camera. At one of his stops, he meets a young woman, Sofia, a village girl who becomes attached to him despite his protests. Tom and Sofia's relationship grows romantic, but when he is exposed as a fraud, he is beaten and arrested. anchor: Two con artists are jailed for stealing vintage wine. After their release, they are hired to develop a machine that can rejuvenate old cars. A car dealership owner wants to use the machine for human rejuvenation. However, the machine malfunctions, and they are transformed into teenagers.
positive: Tom and Jerry, both ex-cons, struggle to find honest work. Jerry convinces Tom to rob a high-tech lab that stores rare minerals. The heist goes awry, and Jerry is killed. Tom is sentenced to life in prison. During his incarceration, he is part of an experimental program to reform inmates. Upon release, Tom is given a new identity and a job as a lab assistant. He soon discovers that the lab is using the inmates for dangerous experiments, and he must decide whether to escape or continue pretending to be reformed.
negative: After her parents' death, young Eliza returns to her ancestral home in the Scottish Highlands. The house, now managed by her uncle, is a shadow of its former glory. Eliza's dreams of finding love and purpose in the village are shattered. She eventually marries a distant cousin she barely knows, just to escape the oppressive environment.
anchor_theme: Unintended consequences of exploiting technology for personal gain.
positive_theme: Redemption and the struggle for a second chance amidst a cycle of crime and deception.
negative_theme: Feeling trapped in an oppressive environment and seeking escape.

anchor: In a remote village, an elder laments that his spirit is no longer in harmony with his body. He yearns for the realm of the ancestors and scolds his spirit for holding him back from the afterlife. He speaks of the mysteries and promises of the spirit world, convinced that the rituals of his people are more valuable than mortal life. He offers his spirit a grand ceremony and a place of honor in the spirit realm, trying to persuade it to let go. His spirit responds by reminding him of the sorrow that death brings and that all, whether chief or commoner, share the same fate. The spirit urges him to embrace life and its joys. The elder, still doubtful, speaks of the hardships of the world and the allure of the spirit realm. The text concludes with the spirit encouraging the elder to continue his rituals but to live fully and not hasten his end.
positive: A young farmer from a small village in the Highlands visited the bustling city of Edinburgh for the first time. He was amazed by a grand castle and a ship filled with exotic goods. He asked locals about the owners, and both times the answer was 'Dinnae Know', meaning 'I don't know'. The farmer, misunderstanding, thought it was the name of a wealthy man called 'Dinnae Know'. He felt both impressed by the supposed Mr. Dinnae Know's wealth and envious of his own poverty. Later, he saw a funeral procession and asked a mourner who had died. When he heard 'Dinnae Know', he mourned for the late Mr. Dinnae Know, realizing that death is an equalizer and life is transient. This insight helped him accept his own humble circumstances.
negative: An elderly woman, whose hands trembled with age, could no longer eat neatly and often spilled her soup, so her son and daughter-in-law made her eat in the kitchen. When she broke the fine china bowl, they gave her a plastic bowl that wouldn't break. Her five-year-old granddaughter played with plastic and said she was making a bowl for her parents to eat from when they were old. After that, they let her eat at the table again and no longer complained about the mess.
anchor_theme: Inner conflict between the desire for transcendence and the will to live.
positive_theme: Misconception and the fleeting nature of wealth and status.
negative_theme: Stigma and isolation due to loss of physical ability, and the power of empathy and understanding.

anchor: A group of international spies arrives in Egypt and plots to control the country's historical artifacts. They start by placing hidden devices in major museums and historical sites. The devices emit subliminal messages that manipulate visitors into becoming a docile and supportive crowd for their takeover. Archaeologist Ahmed, who is on a dig outside the city when the messages begin, and his colleague Sarah, who avoids visiting these sites, remain unaffected. They notice the unusual behavior and start investigating, eventually uncovering the spies' plan.
positive: Maria, a 45-year-old librarian from a small town in Argentina, lives a quiet life with her husband, a local schoolteacher, and their teenage children. In the summer of 1987, during the aftermath of the Dirty War, Maria visits her family's countryside property to help with some maintenance. There, Father González, the town's priest, asks her to assist in caring for Luis, a young activist who has been injured and is hiding from the military. Maria, with her knowledge of first aid and her involvement in community service, agrees to help.

The local sheriff, alarmed by the strange occurrences, hires a team of paranormal investigators to contain the entity. They plan to seal the village by building a massive stone wall around it. However, the entity's power grows, and it manages to escape, leading to a series of unexplained disappearances and deaths in the surrounding area.

positive: Lena, a 48-year-old social worker from a small town in Germany, lives a content life with her husband, a local doctor, and their adult children. In the autumn of 1989, during the fall of the Berlin Wall, Lena visits her family's cottage in the countryside to help with some renovations. There, Father Müller, the town's priest, asks her to assist in caring for Markus, a young activist who has been injured and is hiding from the authorities. Lena, with her medical knowledge and her history of community service, agrees to help.
negative: In a remote village in the Swiss Alps, a group of dark cultists led by a charismatic leader named Dr. Voss summon a powerful and ancient entity. The entity begins to corrupt the village and its inhabitants, spreading a dark influence. The local mayor, alarmed by the strange occurrences, hires a team of paranormal investigators to banish the entity. They plan to seal the village by performing a ritual at the town square. However, the entity's power grows, and it manages to escape, leading to a series of unexplained disappearances and deaths in the surrounding area.
anchor_theme: Manipulation and control through covert means.
positive_theme: Providing aid and shelter to someone in need, while navigating a time of social change.
negative_theme: Corruption and destruction caused by an evil force, and the attempts to stop it.

negative_outcome: The evil force remains at large, causing further harm and destruction, despite efforts to contain it.

anchor: John Marlow, a former soldier, loses his job due to his troubled past. His estranged brother Mark, recently discharged from the military, convinces him to rob a pharmaceutical lab for a valuable new drug. The heist goes awry, and Mark and two others are killed. Sentenced to death, John receives a visit from his wife and son; John tells his son that he won't be coming back. He prepares for the lethal injection, but is next seen hitching a ride from an unknown man who offers him a job as a caretaker at a remote research facility in the mountains. John is told he has been given a second chance and must work there. John wants to return home but is denied, and as time passes, he wonders if he has truly escaped death or if he is part of a sinister experiment.
positive: Tom Harris believed in the justice system, until it affected his life. Tom fondly remembers his brother Mike, but a traumatic brain injury from a childhood accident leaves Mike changed. Two tours in Afghanistan exacerbate Mike's PTSD. After the war, Mike's paranoia leads him to live on the streets. Tom and his family invite Mike to live with them in Denver. One day, Tom discovers something that forces him to choose between protecting his brother or turning him in. Tom struggles with doing the 'right' thing as family ties, mental health, and murder pull him in different directions.
negative: LUNA VII is a military drone designed to resemble its creator, Dr. Luna Thompson. When the drone is damaged during a bank heist, it accesses memories programmed by its creator. With the help of Dr. Thompson, he tries to outsmart the intelligent and emotionally complex robotic doppelgänger.

positive_theme: Conflict between personal loyalty and moral obligation

anchor: The story revolves around a will-they-won't-they romance. Wealthy Alex Hart from Beverly Hills runs off to Los Angeles after his girlfriend's constant flirting. He attends a Fourth of July street fair where Lily James, from Downtown LA, falls in love with him. Comic relief is provided by the local bookstore owner, Mr. Thompson, above whose shop Lily and her roommate, Mia, live. Lily performs a lively singing and dancing routine of the song 'Stay Sunny' for a crowd of her neighbors, complete with a top hat and cane. Later in the film, a lavish dance sequence for the song 'Heat Up', featuring exotic dancers enticing tropical fruits to grow and stiffen, occurs without Lily's participation.
positive: The film, set during World War II, celebrates the work of the Hollywood Canteen, created in Los Angeles as a recreational center for American and Allied servicemen on leave to socialize with, be entertained by, and served by Hollywood celebrities. The storyline follows several women who volunteer for the Canteen and must adhere to strict rules of conduct, the most important of which is to provide friendly companionship and be dance partners for the (often nervous) men who are soon to be sent into combat. No romantic fraternization is allowed. Sarah is a volunteer who confesses to only becoming involved in the Canteen in hopes of being discovered by a famous actor. She ultimately finds herself falling in love with one of the soldiers.
negative: A wealthy heiress falls in love with a middle-class artist of romantically idealistic disposition. In part one, the woman's father hires a hypnotist to program his daughter to instead choose a more suitable suitor selected by him. When that plot is unraveled, the couple secretly marry and flee into the abandoned countryside and attempt to live off the land. After being driven back into the city, the couple live a modest middle-class lifestyle until their money runs out. At that point, they move to the 'underneath' area of Paris to toil in physical labor as lower-class workers. Finally, their issues are resolved through the machinations of her spurned would-be suitor, and they resume a middle-class lifestyle.
anchor_theme: Uncertainty and development of romantic feelings between two individuals from different backgrounds.
positive_theme: Tension between selfless service and personal desire
negative_theme: Conflict between personal desire and societal expectations, and the struggle for true love amidst class differences.
anchor_action: One person escapes a previous relationship, meets someone new, and romantic feelings develop through interactions and shared experiences.
positive_action: Individuals volunteer for a cause, follow strict rules, and face personal challenges that test their motivations and emotions.
negative_action: Couple falls in love, faces opposition, takes drastic measures to be together, endures hardship, and ultimately finds resolution through unexpected means.
anchor_outcome: A potential romantic connection is formed, bringing new possibilities and excitement into the lives of the characters.
positive_outcome: Personal growth and unexpected emotional connections occur despite initial self-interested intentions.
negative_outcome: The couple overcomes obstacles and achieves a stable and comfortable life, reconciling their love with societal pressures.

anchor: The Realm of Shadows is divided into three parts, 'The Ancient Land', 'The Emerging Land', and 'The Unseen Land'. Most of the story takes place in and around the unfinished Temple of Shadows in the 18th century. Its main character is Queen Isabella, her family and court, her friends the blacksmith's daughter Elena and the scholar Marcus, and three mysteriously identical youths, each with thirteen fingers and a black crescent on their back. The main characters are reborn in different eras. The story opens in London on 14th July 1899 and ends in the same city five and a half months later on the eve of a great upheaval. The middle part of the story is a young Seeker's tale of his journey through the Emerging Land.
positive: The Executioner recounts a tale of loyalty tested by two friends during the 18th-century Witch Trials. Orphans James (Tom Hiddleston) and William (Benedict Cumberbatch) bond as children, but take very different paths as adults. William joins the church, while James becomes a military officer. When fate places James in the role of executioner, he must choose between friendship and religious doctrine.
negative: Sicily, the early twentieth century. Wealthy landowner Don Vito hires two hitmen, Vincenzo and Salvatore, to infiltrate a group of labor union activists and eliminate the leaders. After falling in love with the activist Maria, Vincenzo has a change of heart and decides to join the workers.
anchor_theme: Rebirth, identity, and the connection between different eras and lives.
positive_theme: Conflict between loyalty and duty in the face of opposing values
negative_theme: Conflict between loyalty and personal morals
